sen.j: 遠山秀友（とおやま ひでとも、1609年12月2日（慶長14年11月6日 (旧暦)） - 1642年2月6日（寛永19年1月7日 (旧暦)））は、美濃国苗木藩の第2代藩主。
sen.e: Hidetomo TOYAMA (male, December 2, 1609 to February 6, 1642) was the second lord of Naegi Domain in Mino Province.
Hidetomo TOYAMA (December 2, 1609-February 6, 1642) was the second lord of Naegi Domain in Mino Province.
sen.cmt: male, December 2, 1609 to February 6, 1642 をDecember 2, 1609-February 6, 1642 に修正しました。
sen.e: Hidetomo TOYAMA (December 2, 1609-February 6, 1642) was the second lord of Naegi Domain in Mino Province.

sen.j: 初代藩主・遠山友政の長男。
sen.e: Hidetomo was the first son of Tomomasa TOYAMA, the first lord of the domain.
Hidetomo was the first son of Tomomasa TOYAMA, the first lord of the domain.

Hidetomo's formal wife was a daughter of Takayasu MINAGAWA.
Hidetomo's lawful wife was a daughter of Takayasu MINAGAWA.

sen.e: Hidetomo's lawful wife was a daughter of Takayasu MINAGAWA.

sen.j: 継室は大納言・滋野井季吉の娘。
sen.e: Hidetomo's wife in his second marriage was a daughter of Hideyoshi SHIGENOI who was Dainagon (chief councilor of state).
Hidetomo's second wife was a daughter of Hideyoshi SHIGENOI who was Dainagon (chief councilor of state).
sen.cmt: wife in his second marriage を second wife に修正しました。
sen.e: Hidetomo's second wife was a daughter of Hideyoshi SHIGENOI who was Dainagon (chief councilor of state).

sen.j: 子に遠山友貞（長男）、娘（滋野井教広室）。
sen.e: Hidetomo's children were Tomosada TOYAMA (the first son), and a daughter (a wife of Norihiro SHIGENOI).
Hidetomo's children were Tomosada TOYAMA (first son), and a daughter (wife of Norihiro SHIGENOI).

sen.e: Hidetomo's children were Tomosada TOYAMA (first son), and a daughter (wife of Norihiro SHIGENOI).

sen.j: 官位は従五位下、刑部少輔。
sen.e: His official rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and Gyobushonosuke (assistant chief of the gyobusho, the ministry of justice).
His official court rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and Gyobu shoyu (Junior Assistant Minister of Justice).
sen.cmt: official rank を official court rank に修正しました。Gyobushonosuke (assistant chief of the gyobusho, the ministry of justice) をGyobu shoyu (Junior Assistant Minister of Justice) に修正しました。
sen.e: His official court rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and Gyobu shoyu (Junior Assistant Minister of Justice).

sen.j: 慶長14年（1609年）11月6日、苗木にて生まれる。
sen.e: Hidetomo was born in Naegi on November 6, 1609.
Hidetomo was born in Naegi on December 2, 1609.
sen.cmt: November 6, 1609 を December 2, 1609 に修正しました。
sen.e: Hidetomo was born in Naegi on December 2, 1609.

sen.j: 元和 (日本)5年（1619年）12月19日に父が死去したため、翌雁音6年（1620年）に家督を継いだ。
sen.e: Because Hidetomo's father died on December 19, 1619, Hidetomo succeeded his father as the head of his family in 1620.
As Hidetomo's father died on January 23, 1620, he succeeded to his father to take over the position of the family head in the same year.
As Hidetomo's father died on January 23, 1620, he succeeded to his father to take over the position of the family head in the same year.

sen.j: 大坂城番や江戸城本丸の奥の間普請などで功を挙げた。
sen.e: Hidetomo distinguished himself with his achievements such as guarding Osaka-jo castle and remodeling the deepest room in the main enclosure of Edo-jo castle.
Hidetomo distinguished himself with his achievements such as guarding Osaka-jo Castle and remodeling the Okunoma (inner room) in the Honmaru (castle keep) of Edo-jo Castle.

sen.j: 寛永19年（1642年）正月7日、苗木にて死去。
sen.e: Hidetomo died in Naegi on January 7, 1642.
Hidetomo died in Naegi on February 6, 1642.
sen.cmt: January 7 を February 6 に修正しました。
sen.e: Hidetomo died in Naegi on February 6, 1642.

He died at the age of 34.

sen.j: 後を長男の友貞が継いだ。
sen.e: Hidetomo's first son, Tomosada succeeded him.
His first son, Tomosada succeeded him.

sen.e: His first son, Tomosada succeeded him.

sen.j: 墓所は、中津川市苗木の雲林寺。
sen.e: Hidetomo's grave is located in Unrin-ji temple in Naegi in Nakatsugawa City.
